description: How the Ju Lab does Western Blots
before_start: Make sure you have a frozen ice block for the Bio-Rad container and have at least 800 mL of 1x Transfer Buffer chilled to 4 C.

components.data: Place gels in the Bio-Rad gel running apparatus and make sure they are locked into place, then pour 1x Protein Running Buffer inbetween the two gels until it's about 25% full to ensure there are no leaks. After no leaks have been found, fill the middle up the rest of the way up so it covers the top of the wells and pour 1x Protein Running Buffer outside of the gels so it covers the bottom of the glass.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place gels in the Bio-Rad gel running apparatus and make sure they are locked into place, then pour 1x Protein Running Buffer inbetween the two gels until it's about 25% full to ensure there are no leaks. After no leaks have been found, fill the middle up the rest of the way up so it covers the top of the wells and pour 1x Protein Running Buffer outside of the gels so it covers the bottom of the glass.

components.data: 25 mM Tris
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 25 mM Tris

components.data: 190 mM glycine
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 190 mM glycine

components.data: 20% Methanol
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 20% Methanol

components.data: Check pH and adjust to 8.3 if necessary
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check pH and adjust to 8.3 if necessary

components.data: Remove the combs from each gel and wash lanes a few times with 1x Protein Running Buffer, then load your samples and ladder. In any unused wells, fill them up with a similar volume that you loaded your samples with of 1x Protein Running Buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the combs from each gel and wash lanes a few times with 1x Protein Running Buffer, then load your samples and ladder. In any unused wells, fill them up with a similar volume that you loaded your samples with of 1x Protein Running Buffer.

components.data: Run 10% gels at 150 volts until the ladder reaches the bottom of the glass.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run 10% gels at 150 volts until the ladder reaches the bottom of the glass.

components.data: Cut nitrocellulose membrane and pieces of filter paper to the same size as the gel, and cut one corner so you are able to orient yourself to which side is the front or back, then soak in 100% methanol, followed by quickly submerging in 1x Transfer Buffer for at least 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut nitrocellulose membrane and pieces of filter paper to the same size as the gel, and cut one corner so you are able to orient yourself to which side is the front or back, then soak in 100% methanol, followed by quickly submerging in 1x Transfer Buffer for at least 15 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 5 of Western Blot
source_data.annotation: Make sure you never touch the membrane with your bare hand, otherwise it'll leave a mark when  you try to develop it.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure you never touch the membrane with your bare hand, otherwise it'll leave a mark when  you try to develop it.
source_data.body: Make sure you never touch the membrane with your bare hand, otherwise it'll leave a mark when  you try to develop it.

components.data: Pour out 1x Protein Running Buffer (can reuse 1 time) into a bottle and then remove the gels from the gel apparatus. Separate the glass pieces, remove the gel, cut off and discard the stacking portion, and submerge the separating portion in 1x Transfer Buffer for at least 15 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour out 1x Protein Running Buffer (can reuse 1 time) into a bottle and then remove the gels from the gel apparatus. Separate the glass pieces, remove the gel, cut off and discard the stacking portion, and submerge the separating portion in 1x Transfer Buffer for at least 15 minutes

components.data: Pour 1x Transfer Buffer into Bio-Rad transfer apparatus and soak both sponges and filter paper in the buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour 1x Transfer Buffer into Bio-Rad transfer apparatus and soak both sponges and filter paper in the buffer.

components.data:
Open up plastic sandwich, and starting with the clear side:

  1. Place a wet sponge down
  2. Place a wet piece of filter paper
  3. Place the nitrocellulose membrane onto the filter paper (down in the middle first then let each side down so you have no air bubbles)
  4. Place the gel on the same way
  5. Place the other piece of filter paper down the same way
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Open up plastic sandwich, and starting with the clear side:

  1. Place a wet sponge down
  2. Place a wet piece of filter paper
  3. Place the nitrocellulose membrane onto the filter paper (down in the middle first then let each side down so you have no air bubbles)
  4. Place the gel on the same way
  5. Place the other piece of filter paper down the same way

components.data: Use a 15 mL centrifuge tube and roll from one side of the sandwich to the other to ensure there are no air bubbles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use a 15 mL centrifuge tube and roll from one side of the sandwich to the other to ensure there are no air bubbles.

components.data: Place the other sponge on top, then fold the black side up and lock the clear and black sides together so there is a complete sandwich, and load it into the center of the transfer apparatus, so that the black side of the sandwich matches the black side of the sandwich holder, and the clear side is closer to the red side of the sandwich holder.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the other sponge on top, then fold the black side up and lock the clear and black sides together so there is a complete sandwich, and load it into the center of the transfer apparatus, so that the black side of the sandwich matches the black side of the sandwich holder, and the clear side is closer to the red side of the sandwich holder.

components.data: Load the ice block into the apparatus then fill the Bio-Rad container to the top with chilled 1x Transfer Buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load the ice block into the apparatus then fill the Bio-Rad container to the top with chilled 1x Transfer Buffer.

components.data: Add the lid to the container, plug it into the amplifier, and perform the transfer at room temperature at 50 volts for two hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the lid to the container, plug it into the amplifier, and perform the transfer at room temperature at 50 volts for two hours.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 11 of Western Blot
source_data.annotation: DO NOT INTERRUPT THE TRANSFER PROCESS OR YOUR SAMPLE WILL BE LOST.
source_data.thread_text: DO NOT INTERRUPT THE TRANSFER PROCESS OR YOUR SAMPLE WILL BE LOST.
source_data.body: DO NOT INTERRUPT THE TRANSFER PROCESS OR YOUR SAMPLE WILL BE LOST.

components.data: Remove membrane from sandwich, rinse with water, and submerge in TBST + 5% Milk with shaking for two hours to initiate blocking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove membrane from sandwich, rinse with water, and submerge in TBST + 5% Milk with shaking for two hours to initiate blocking.

components.data: 20 mM Tris pH 7.5
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 20 mM Tris pH 7.5

components.data: 150 mM NaCl
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 150 mM NaCl

components.data: 0.1% Tween 2
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 0.1% Tween 2

components.data: 5% Dry Milk
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 5% Dry Milk

components.data: Dump the TBST + Milk, then add 10 mL of fresh TBST + 5% Milk and 1 uL Primary Antibody (all mixed together before submerging the membrane in it) and let it rock at 4 C from two hours to overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dump the TBST + Milk, then add 10 mL of fresh TBST + 5% Milk and 1 uL Primary Antibody (all mixed together before submerging the membrane in it) and let it rock at 4 C from two hours to overnight.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 13 of Western Blot
source_data.annotation: The specific amount of your antibody to add will be based on antibody specifics, for our lab and our set of antibodies this ratio works well.
source_data.thread_text: The specific amount of your antibody to add will be based on antibody specifics, for our lab and our set of antibodies this ratio works well.
source_data.body: The specific amount of your antibody to add will be based on antibody specifics, for our lab and our set of antibodies this ratio works well.

components.data: 20 mM Tris pH 7.5
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 20 mM Tris pH 7.5

components.data: 150 mM NaCl
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 150 mM NaCl

components.data: 0.1% Tween 2
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 0.1% Tween 2

components.data: 5% Dry Milk
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 5% Dry Milk

components.data: Pour off TBST and 5% Milk with the Antibody and do five 10 minute washes with TBST and shaking at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour off TBST and 5% Milk with the Antibody and do five 10 minute washes with TBST and shaking at room temperature.

components.data: 20 mM Tris pH 7.5
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 20 mM Tris pH 7.5

components.data: 150 mM NaCl
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 150 mM NaCl

components.data: Dump the TBST, then add 10 mL of fresh TBST + 5% Milk and 1 uL Secondary Antibody (all mixed together before submerging the membrane in it) and let it incubate while shaking at room temperature for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dump the TBST, then add 10 mL of fresh TBST + 5% Milk and 1 uL Secondary Antibody (all mixed together before submerging the membrane in it) and let it incubate while shaking at room temperature for 1 hour.

components.data: Pour off TBST and 5% Milk with the Antibody and do five 10 minute washes with TBST and shaking at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour off TBST and 5% Milk with the Antibody and do five 10 minute washes with TBST and shaking at room temperature.

components.data: Add just enough BCIP/NBT to cover the membrane and let it shake at room temperature until bands develop.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add just enough BCIP/NBT to cover the membrane and let it shake at room temperature until bands develop.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 17 of Western Blot
source_data.annotation: If the membrane starts turning purple then it has been exposed for too long.
source_data.thread_text: If the membrane starts turning purple then it has been exposed for too long.
source_data.body: If the membrane starts turning purple then it has been exposed for too long.
